pullRequest.title: New Types Support On Portable For Sql
pullRequest.bodyText:
The following types are added to the Portable. The need comes from the SQL work.
BigDecimal,LocalTime,LocalDate,LocalDateTime,OffsetDateTime
Each one has its own method on PortableReader/Writer, GenericRecord/Builder, ClassDefinitionBuilder, etc.. Also, the support for the array of each type is also added.
We did not add these types to ObjectDataOutput/Input or to root serializers.

beforeCommit.message:
New Types Support On Serialization For Sql

The following types are added to serialization system.
The need comes from the SQL work.

BigInteger,BigDecimal,LocalTime,LocalDate
,LocalDateTime,OffsetDateTime

Added root serializers for each of the type. That means that
these types can be put to any data structure. They were
serialized via default Java Serialization before. Now, they
have their own serializer id's. That means that these can be
added to any non-java client, and they can be distinguised
by id when doing query.

These types are also added to Portable. Each one have their own
method on PortableReader/Writer. Also the support for Array of
each type is also added. Note that a field of an array can be
null. Since writeUTFArray had a null item support on arrays,
the rest  is made inline with that.

We did not add new types to ObjectDataOutput/Input classes.
DataSerializable/IdentifiedDataSerializable does not support
them. The reason behind it that, they already have write/readObject
This enables using these classes on Java. For non-java clients,
this work is posptponed for now(because it is likely that we
will deprecate DataSerializable soon)

commit.message:
New Types Support On Portable For Sql

The following types are added to the Portable. The need comes from the SQL work.

BigDecimal,LocalTime,LocalDate,LocalDateTime,OffsetDateTime

Each one has its own method on PortableReader/Writer, GenericRecord/Builder,
ClassDefinitionBuilder, etc.. Also, the support for the array of each type is also added.

We did not add these types to ObjectDataOutput/Input or to root serializers.

Add missing parts on AbstractGenericRecord

also add tests for missing part

nodes.bodyText: It seems that this code piece is duplicated. Maybe we can put it into a separate function
We can add @Nullable annotation to portable parameter
Minor: Should we add @Nullable annotation to the return value? We do it for parameters and IDE shows a warning about that in the super class
Minor: There are some missing @Nullable annotations in this file
This is the second time we define such an interface. Maybe we can define this once in IOUtil. (and Writer interface used in other files)
Should we add @Nullable annotation to the return value?
On what conditions can pos be -1?
There is also a lot of duplication here
year , month -> year, month

year , month -> year, month
month of the year and day of the month -> month of the year, day of the month

year , month -> year, month
month of the year and day of the month -> month of the year, day of the month
Does that suppress all checks? If so, it might be dangerous.

               files="com[\\/]hazelcast[\\/]internal[\\/]serialization[\\/]impl[\\/]portable[\\/]PortableInternalGenericRecord"/>
     <suppress checks="MagicNumber"
+              files="com[\\/]hazelcast[\\/]internal[\\/]serialization[\\/]impl[\\/]portable[\\/]PortableValueReader"/>

nodes.bodyText: Missing @Nullable annotation in the return value
Same applies to PortableReader, PortableWriter and GenericRecord javadocs
Same applies to PortableReader, PortableWriter and GenericRecord javadocs
Same applies to PortableReader, PortableWriter and GenericRecord javadocs
Is this check also unnecessary?
nit: could be marked with @FunctionalInterface
nit: could be marked with @FunctionalInterface
nit: could be private
nit: consider renaming to newUnknownFieldException

nit: does it make sense to @Nonnull in private method? If you think it makes sense, constructor parameter and return type also need to be annotated. The same consideration applies to other privates methods in this class.
nit: consider renaming to newIllegalStateException
nit: might be a good idea to include some details from e into the final exception
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -367,7 +485,7 @@ private IllegalStateException illegalStateException(IOException e) {
         return new IllegalStateException("IOException is not expected since we read from a well known format and position");

nodes.bodyText: nit: needs @Nullable annotation for return type. The same consideration applies to other public methods in this class.
Should be removed in favor of javax.annotation.Nonnull
nit: return type could be annotated with @Nonnull here and in other public methods in this class

nit: does it make sense to mention j.t.LocalTime class here? Otherwise, method's javadoc reads as if the final Portable supports multiple options for time field type. The same question applies to other newly introduced methods (incl. addDecimalField).
Also, current javadoc seems to provide internal details on how the field is serialized into a binary. Is it on purpose?

nit: dot is missing here and in other new methods' javadoc

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Adds a decimal which is arbitrary precision and scale floating-point number to the class definition
          
          
            
                 * Adds a decimal which is arbitrary precision and scale floating-point number to the class definition.
nit: we should reference j.m.BigDecimal instead of Decimal

nit: does it make sense to use BIG_DECIMAL instead of DECIMAL here and in related public methods? Decimal does not provide a hint that it's an arbitrary precision number. Say, both double and float types stand for decimal numbers.

-    UTF_ARRAY(19, MAX_VALUE);
+    UTF_ARRAY(19, MAX_VALUE),
+
+    DECIMAL(20, MAX_VALUE),

nodes.bodyText: nit: might be a good idea to put a comment on backward compatibility for types with id > 19. Or, at least describe the changed structure as TYPES_COUNT constant being 10 doesn't make sense anymore.

nodes.bodyText:
nit: trailing dot is missing here and in below.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Reads a decimal which is arbitrary precision and scale floating-point number to BigDecimal
          
          
            
                 * Reads a decimal which is arbitrary precision and scale floating-point number to BigDecimal.
nit: might be a good idea to mark return type with @Nonnull here and in other builder methods
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -467,11 +599,89 @@ static Builder portable(@Nonnull ClassDefinition classDefinition) {
         Builder writeGenericRecord(@Nonnull String fieldName, @Nullable GenericRecord value);
 
         /**
+         * Writes a decimal which is arbitrary precision and scale floating-point number
          * It is illegal to write to the same field twice.
          *
          * @param fieldName name of the field as it is defined in its class definition.
          *                  See {@link ClassDefinition} for {@link Portable}
-         * @param value
+         * @param value     to set to GenericRecord
+         * @return itself for chaining
+         * @throws HazelcastSerializationException if the field name does not exist in the class definition or
+         *                                         the type of the field does not match the one in the class definition or
+         *                                         Same field is trying to be overwritten without using
+         *                                         {@link GenericRecord#cloneWithBuilder()}.
+         */
+        Builder writeDecimal(@Nonnull String fieldName, @Nullable BigDecimal value);
